Oxidative metabolism

Oxidative metabolism Of glucose, follows the formula:

C 6 H 12 O 6 + 6O2 â†’ 6CO2 + 6H 2 O.

For any fat, protein or carbohydrate of general formula (C c H h O o ), the number of oxygen molecules needed for complete oxidation (to CO2 and H2O) is given by: c + h/4 - o/2. See glycolysis , and mitochondrial metabolism.
